workflow.name: Automate customer support with GPT-4o, Slack, and CRM integration
workflow.description:
üßæ Short Description

An AI-powered customer support workflow that automatically triages, summarizes, classifies, and routes tickets to the right Slack and CRM queues. It sends personalized auto-replies, logs results to Google Sheets, and uses a DLQ for failed cases.

‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

Trigger: Captures messages from email or form submissions.

AI Triage: Summarizes and classifies issues, scores urgency, and suggests next steps.

Routing: Directs to Slack or CRM queue based on type and priority.

Logging: Records summaries, urgency, and responses in Google Sheets.

Auto-Reply: Sends an acknowledgment email with ticket ID and SLA timeframe.

Error Handling: Failed triage or delivery attempts are logged in a DLQ.

üß© How to Use

1. Configure triggers (email or webhook) and connect credentials for OpenAI, Slack, Gmail, and Google Sheets.

2. In Workflow Configuration, set:

    * Slack Channel IDs

    * CRM Type (HubSpot, Salesforce, or custom)

    * Google Sheet URL

    * SLA thresholds (e.g., 2h, 6h, 24h)

3. Test with a sample ticket and verify routing and summaries in Slack and Sheets.

üîë Requirements

OpenAI API key (GPT-4o-mini or newer)

Slack OAuth credentials

Google Sheets API access

Gmail/SMTP credentials

CRM API (HubSpot, Salesforce, or custom endpoint)

üí° Customization Ideas

Add sentiment detection for customer tone.

Localize responses for multilingual support.

Extend DLQ logging to Notion or Airtable.

Add escalation alerts for SLA breaches.

workflow.name: AI Customer Support Triage & Summarization System

assignments.name: emailBody

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ { "workflow": "AI Customer Support Auto-Reply", "error": "Failed to send auto-reply after 3 attempts", "timestamp": $now.toISO(), "customerEmail": $json.customerEmail, "referenceNumber": $json.referenceNumber, "data": $json } }}

parameters.content:
# üü¢ Setup & Intake

## Configure your email or webhook trigger for new support tickets.  

## Update the ‚ÄúWorkflow Configuration‚Äù node:

## Slack Channel IDs

## CRM Type (HubSpot or Salesforce)

## Google Sheet ID

## SLA (Service Level Agreement) thresholds  

## Connect credentials for OpenAI, Slack, Google Sheets, and Gmail before running.

# ü§ñ AI Triage

## The AI Triage & Summarization node uses OpenAI to:
## Summarize the message (<200 words)
## Classify issue type (technical, billing, general, urgent)
## Assign urgency (1‚Äì5)
## Suggest next action  
## Model: GPT 5 (editable).  
## Output feeds into routing, logging, and auto-reply generation.

# üîÄ Routing & Logging
## Route by Classification directs tickets to Slack channels & CRM task queues.  
## Each triaged ticket is logged to Google Sheets with:
## Timestamp
## Classification & urgency
## AI summary & suggested action  
## Failed or missing data goes to the DLQ tab for review.

# ‚úâÔ∏è Auto-Reply & Error Handling
## The ‚ÄúAuto-Reply Generator‚Äù node drafts a personalized acknowledgment email with:
## Customer name
##  Issue summary
## Ticket ID & support SLA timeframe  
## Email sent via Gmail or SMTP.  
## Invalid or failed triage attempts are logged to the DLQ for auditing.

# üî¥ Error Handler ‚Äì Log to DLQ
## Optional global error catcher for failed executions. Configure  with your Google Sheet DLQ tab or remove if handling errors elsewhere in the workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
